item.title: Understanding a Postgres query plan
item.description: A query plan is a sequence of steps used by a database to access data. Being able to read a query plan is key to understanding the performance of an SQL query. While tuning a query we need to know how the rows are being fetched from the tables? Are the indexes being used? What is the cost of joining to tables? A query plan provides with an answer for all of these questions.
